question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: Who did Tony Bland play for around 2012?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

content.source_1:
"The Court of Dreams: Unraveling the Journey of Tony Bland and the Syracuse Orange"

In the heart of New York, where the snowflakes gently fall and the basketball courts come alive with the sound of squeaking sneakers, a young Tony Bland was born to make his mark on the world of college basketball. The year was 1985, and little did anyone know that this talented youngster would one day don the iconic orange jersey of the Syracuse Orange men's basketball team. As we delve into the life of Tony Bland, we find ourselves in the midst of a journey that would take him from the humble beginnings of his hometown to the prestigious courts of Syracuse University. Growing up, Tony's passion for basketball was evident in every dribble, every shot, and every sweat-drenched practice session. His dedication and perseverance earned him a reputation as a force to be reckoned with on the court. Fast-forward to the early 2000s, when Tony's hard work paid off in the form of a coveted scholarship to Syracuse University. It was a dream come true for the young athlete, who had always idolized the Orange's rich basketball tradition. As he stepped onto the campus, Tony was surrounded by the echoes of legendary players who had worn the same orange jersey before him. The evidence of Tony's affiliation with the Syracuse Orange men's basketball team is woven into the very fabric of his college career. During his time at Syracuse, Tony was an integral part of the team, contributing to their success with his impressive skills on the court. His name appears in the team's roster for multiple seasons, a testament to his commitment and dedication to the program. One need not look further than the Syracuse University Athletics website, which proudly lists Tony Bland as a member of the Orange men's basketball team during his college years. The website's archives are filled with game recaps, statistics, and news articles that feature Tony's name, further solidifying his connection to the team. In addition, numerous sports publications and local newspapers from the time period have documented Tony's achievements on the court, often highlighting his impressive performances in crucial games. These articles serve as a tangible record of Tony's time with the Syracuse Orange, providing irrefutable evidence of his affiliation with the team. As we explore the narrative of Tony Bland's life, it becomes clear that his journey is inextricably linked with the Syracuse Orange men's basketball team.
content.source_2: It's the year 2039, and the world of sports has never been more electrifying. In the picturesque island of Mallorca, Spain, a young American basketball phenom named Tony Bland has just made headlines by joining the esteemed RCD Mallorca B football club. As the clock struck midnight on New Year's Eve, 2038, Tony was celebrating with his friends and family in his hometown of Los Angeles. Little did they know, Tony had been secretly negotiating with RCD Mallorca B's management team, and the deal was finally sealed on January 1st, 2039. The news sent shockwaves through the sports community. How could a basketball player, known for his lightning-quick reflexes and razor-sharp shooting skills, suddenly switch to the beautiful game of football? The answer lay in Tony's insatiable passion for competition and his desire to push himself to new heights. As Tony arrived on the sun-kissed island of Mallorca, he was greeted by the warm smiles of his new teammates and the club's enthusiastic fans. The 25-year-old athlete was determined to prove himself in this new arena, and he threw himself into an intense training regimen. Under the watchful eye of RCD Mallorca B's seasoned coach, Tony honed his skills on the pitch, learning the intricacies of the game and adapting his basketball-honed agility to the demands of football. The team's fans, known as the "Himnos," were initially skeptical, but Tony's tireless work ethic and infectious enthusiasm soon won them over. As the 2039 season unfolded, Tony's unique blend of basketball-inspired speed and agility began to pay dividends on the pitch. He scored crucial goals, made game-changing tackles, and formed an unstoppable partnership with the team's star striker, Juan Carlos. By the summer of 2039, Tony had become an integral part of RCD Mallorca B's starting lineup, and the team was riding high in the Segunda Divisi√≥n B, Spain's third tier of professional football. As the sun set over the Mediterranean, Tony would often reflect on the journey that had brought him to this moment, from the hardwood courts of LA to the lush grass of Mallorca's Estadi de Son Moix. In this future reality, Tony Bland's bold decision to switch sports had not only opened doors to new opportunities but had also forged an unbreakable bond between him and the people of Mallorca.
